properties.media:imagetext:
727-200
For your safety
If you are sitting in an exit row please identify yourself to a crew member to allow for reseating if: You lack the
ability to read, speak, or understand English, or the graphic form, or the ability to understand oral crew commands.
Para su Seguridad
Por favor identifiquese con un tripulante para ser cambiado de asiento si usted está sentado en una de las hilera
de la salida, y si tiene problemas para: leer, hablar, y entender inglés, instrucciones gráficas o la dificultad para
entender ordenes verbales de la tripulación.
Pour votre Sécurité
Si vous êtes assis sur une rangée située près d'une sortie veuillez vous identifier à un membre de l'equipage afin
que l'on vous attribue un autre siège si: vous ne pouvez pas lire, parler ou comprendre la l'anglais ou les
illustrations graphiques, ou bien si vous ne pouvez comprendre les instructions orales de l'equipage.
Für ihre Sicherheit
Wenn Sie in einer Reihe von Sitzen neben einem Notausgang sitzen, müssen Sie die Flugzeugbesatzung
verständigen, damit diese Ihnen einen neuen Platz zuteilen kann, sollten Sie: Englisch nicht sprechen, lesen oder
verstehen können, oder die grafischen Darstellungen nicht verstehen, oder sollten Sie die mündlichen
Anordnungen der Flugzeugbesatzung nicht verstehen.
Emergency exits are often heavy, awkward to lift, push, pull, and maneuver when opening. Because of this, and
for the benefit of all passengers, Federal Law requires that we seat only able bodied passengers next to
emergency exits. If you are sitting next to an exit, you may be asked to open the exit and assist our crew in the
event of an emergency. To sit in an exit seat you must:
a) Have sufficient mobility, strength, or dexterity in both arms and hands, and both legs to perform all the
applicable functions listed or depicted on this card.
b) Be at least 15 years of age and able to perform all the functions without the assistance of a parent or adult
companion.
c) Be able to read well enough to understand these instructions and other signs or placards related to opening
exits and other emergency procedures.
d) See well enough to perform all of the functions (You may wear glasses or contact lenses).
e) Hear well enough to understand commands (You may wear a hearing aid).
f) Must speak or shout well enough to give information to other passengers during an emergency.
g) Not have responsibilities, such as caring for small children, that might prevent you from performing all of the
applicable functions.
h) Not have a condition that might cause you harm if you perform one or more of the applicable functions.
If you are seated in an exit seat you must identify yourself to allow for reseating if you:
a) Cannot meet the selection criteria listed above;
b) Have a nondiscernible condition that will prevent you from performing the applicable functions listed or depicted
on this card;
c) May suffer bodily harm from performing one or more of the functions;
d) Lack the ability to read, speak and understand the language, or to understand the graphic form, in which
instructions related to emergency evacuation are depicted on this card, or;
e) Do not wish to perform the functions (no reason needs to be given).
All passengers should follow these guidelines and be prepared for an emergency:
1) Follow these instructions, the directions of the crew, and all posted signs.
2) Know the location and operation of all emergency equipment and exits.
3) In an emergency evacuation, if a crew member cannot reach an exit near you, you may have to open it.
4) ONLY open the exit after the plane has completely come to a stop.
5) Look outside: If fire, smoke, or water could come in through the exit, do not open it, direct passengers to usable exits.
6) If it is safe to open the exit, open it quickly and clear a pathway in the row to the exit.
7) Shout "Open seatbelts!", "Come this way!" and exit the airplane as quickly as possible.
8) Help other passengers out of the airplane, if there is no immediate danger.
9) Direct passengers to a safe path away and quickly get yourself clear of the airplane.
Federal Regulations
prohibit the removal
of this Safety Card
from the aircraft.
(Rev. 2/00)
Champion Air
